full_content.content: Common reasons your LG dryer is leaking
The most common reasons your LG dryer is leaking are a worn drum support roller, defective electronic control board or an open heating element.
We can help! Our service technicians have repaired over
LG dryers. We can fix yours no matter where you bought it.
Most common repairs needed to fix a LG dryer

When a condensing or ventless dryer is leaking, a worn drum support roller could be causing the problem. The drum support roller holds the drum in place inside the dryer. Moist air can leak out of the drum when the support roller doesn’t hold the drum in place properly. Have a Sears Home Services Appliance Technician examine the dryer when it leaks water from the bottom. The technician will replace the drum support roller if it’s worn or damaged.
How to replace a dryer drum support roller

When a condensing or ventless dryer is leaking, a defective electronic control board may be failing to send electric current to the drain pump motor. A failed relay on the control board won’t allow current to flow to the drain pump to drain condensate. A problem with internal control board logic could be preventing the control from detecting conditions inside the dryer. When your dryer is leaking water, have a Sears Home Services Repair Expert visit your home and fix the problem.
How to replace the electronic control board in an electric dryer

When your condensing or ventless dryer is leaking, an open heating element could be causing the problem. The electronic control board on a condensing dryer will sense an open heating element and typically halt all dryer operations. The drain pump won’t get power from the electronic control board to drain condensate water when the control board detects a problem with the heating element. When your dryer leaking water, have a Sears Home Services Technician visit your home and fix the dryer.
How to replace a dryer heating element
What to expect when you experience an LG dryer leaking issue
How is the leaking problem fixed?

Correcting most leaking problems usually involves replacing the drum support roller, electronic control board or heating element. However, there are many potential causes, so a thorough diagnosis is key to fixing the problem. An accurate diagnosis is essential to understanding how much the repair will be.
Sears Home Services recommendations for a dryer that is leaking
When the dryer is leaking it can be for many reasons. To avoid replacing unneeded parts, we recommend scheduling
with a local Sears Home Services professional who can perform diagnostic tests to identify the root cause of the problem. Our technicians are experienced at diagnosing all types of dryer failures.
What to look out for with a dryer leaking diagnosis

Diagnosing modern appliances without proper knowledge and training can be difficult. Without using proper diagnostic techniques, fixing your dryer problem will only be achieved through changing parts on a hunch. Appliances, especially in the last 10 years, have become extremely advanced, and many models have electronic parts that are difficult to test. DIY repairs on the latest appliance models are becoming increasingly difficult.
Leaks under or around an LG dryer can stem from blocked vent lines or misplaced drain hoses if it’s a steam model. Lingering moisture jeopardizes floors and fosters mildew. Rather than guess, trust
for accurate fixes. Stopping leaks early protects your home and your dryer.
What our customers say about us
With more than 1.3 Million 5 Star Reviews, you don't have to take our word for it

full_content.content: Why does my LG dryer show signs of water leakage?
A clogged or restricted drain hose, faulty or damaged drain pump or a cracked water container can cause leaks.
How do I clear a blocked dryer vent hose?
Unplug the dryer, detach the vent hose from the exhaust port, and remove lint or debris with a brush. Also check the external vent flap for obstructions.
Can a clog in the condensate system in a ventless dryer lead to leaking?
Yes. If the condensation system or drain line is clogged, water can accumulate and overflow. Cleaning or repairing the drain often fixes the leak.
When do I need a technician for an LG dryer that’s leaking water?
If vent cleaning or simple checks don’t stop the leak, the dryer’s internal condenser or pump assembly may be failing. A pro can diagnose specialized parts in ventless models.

full_content.content: Deciphering Samsung Clothes Dryer Error Codes
Find the most common Samsung clothes dryer error codes and their solutions. Get professional help from Sears Home Services.
A dryer drum is the main interior component of a clothes dryer where clothes are placed to be dried. It rotates during the drying cycle, allowing heated air to circulate through the clothes.

A dryer filter, commonly known as a lint filter, is a component of a clothes dryer that captures lint and other debris from clothes during the drying process, preventing them from clogging the dryer vent.
A dryer pedestal is a platform that elevates a dryer off the ground, making it easier to load and unload laundry while also providing additional storage space in some models.

A dryer rack is an accessory for clothes dryers that provides a stationary platform to dry items without tumbling, ideal for delicate or bulky items, or shoes that might be damaged by the usual drying cycle.
Additional possible LG dryer symptoms you may experience
LG dryer makes noise when tumbling
LG dryer not drying clothes properly
LG dryer clean filter light won't turn off

Notice of Right to Opt Out of Sale/Sharing

This website uses cookies and other tracking technologies (“Cookies”) to serve targeted ads, enhance user experience, and to analyze user activity. Some Cookies may collect personal information that is used in a way that is considered a “Sale”, “Sharing”, or “Targeted Advertising” as those terms are defined under various state privacy laws. To opt out of Cookie based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising, please follow the instructions below. To opt out of non-Cookie based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising, please visit our webform
. Please visit our Privacy Policy linked below, including the State Specific Disclosures section for more information about your rights and our privacy practices.

full_content.attributes: {'href': 'https://www.searshomeservices.com/privacy#california-residents', 'class': ['privacy-notice-link'], 'rel': ['noopener'], 'target': '_blank', 'aria-label': 'More information about your privacy, opens in a new tab'}

full_content.content: You can move the toggle above to the left to opt out of Cookie-based Sales, Sharing, and Targeted Advertising. Please note that your opt-out choice is specific to this website, browser, and device. If you access other Transformco websites, you will need to make your election for each. Also, if you clear your Cookies on this browser or use another browser or device, you may need to opt out again on this website.

Please note: Opting out may affect our ability to personalize your experience on this website, though we may use Cookies that do not include Sales, Sharing, or Targeted Advertising. You may still receive non-personalized advertisements on other sites or personalized ads that may be based on information processed before you opted out.

This website recognizes the Global Privacy Control (“GPC”), which is designed to recognize certain browser-based opt-out preference signals. We will process the GPC signal as a request to opt out. To process your request through GPC, you must use a browser or browser extension that supports the signal and turn it on for each browser and device you use.
